pageFactoryReset.alert: System must be powered off to reset
pageFactoryReset.description: These functions do not perform a secure delete of any sensitive data.

form.resetBiosOptionHelperText: Resets server settings including: Platform keystore, partition NVRAM, partition configurations, and event logs.
form.resetToDefaultsOptionHelperText: In addition to server settings, this option resets BMC settings, including: all BMC account data, all changed passwords, all policies, LDAP configurations, network addresses, and time of day.

modal.resetBiosHeader: Do you want to reset the server settings?

resetBiosSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetBiosSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.

modal.resetToDefaultsHeader: Do you want to reset both the BMC and server settings?

resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item1: All manual settings will be deleted.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item2: Partition configurations and the platform keystore may be recovered if backups exist.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item3: All BMC logs will be removed.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item4: Currently active sessions on all network interfaces will be disconnected.
resetToDefaultsSettingsList.item5: The BMC default account and password settings will be restored.

modal.resetWarningCheckLabel: Continue without shutting down the system
modal.resetWarningMessage: Resetting without shutting down the system might cause an unrecoverable error.

toast.resetBiosError: Factory reset of server settings failed.
toast.resetBiosSuccess: Factory reset of server settings successful.
toast.resetToDefaultsError: Factory reset of BMC and server settings failed.
toast.resetToDefaultsSuccess: Factory reset of BMC and server settings successful. If you are not automatically logged out, refresh the browser.

modal.switchRunningImageInfo: A BMC reboot is required to run the backup image. The application might be unresponsive during this time.
modal.switchRunningImageInfo2: Are you sure you want to switch to the backup image (%{backup})?
modal.updateFirmwareInfo: The BMC will reboot during the update process. The server cannot be powered on until the update is finished.
modal.updateFirmwareInfo2: The running image (%{running}) will be copied to backup. The backup image will be deleted.
modal.updateFirmwareInfo3: Are you sure you want to proceed with the update?
modal.updateFirmwareInfoDefault: The new image will be uploaded and activated. After that, the BMC or host will reboot automatically to run from the new image.

toast.rebootStartedMessage: Successfully started reboot from backup image. Reboot might take several minutes to complete.

pageMemory.activeMemoryMirroringDescription: Active Memory Mirroring for hypervisor is designed to ensure that system operation continues even in the unlikely event of an uncorrectable error occurring in main memory used by the system hypervisor.
pageMemory.activeMemoryMirroringHelpText: Specifies if memory mirroring is enabled, requires a reboot for the change to be applied.
pageMemory.ioAdapterEnlargedCapacity: This option controls the size of PCI memory space allocated to each PCI slot.
pageMemory.logicalMemorySizeHeading: Logical memory block size is used for partitioning. Changing the logical memory block size impacts system resource management.
pageMemory.systemMemoryPageSetup: Improve the application's performance by setting large virtual memory page sizes of 16GB each.

pagePolicies.hostTpmDescription: Enable to ensure the system only boots when the TPM is functional.
pagePolicies.hostUsbDescription: Specifies if Host USB is disabled or enabled for security reasons.
pagePolicies.ipmiDescription: Allow remote management of the platform via IPMI. Tools such as ipmitool require this setting to be enabled. Once enabled, please follow the procedure in the online support documentation to add IPMI users.
pagePolicies.rtadDescription: This option enables or disables the Remote Trusted Attestation Daemon for host firmware.
pagePolicies.secureVersionDescription: Specifies whether the secure version lock-in functionality is enabled.
pagePolicies.sshDescription: Allow access to shell sessions via SSH, through port 22 on the BMC.
pagePolicies.usbFirmwareUpdatePolicyDescription: Enabling the USB Firmware Update Policy will enable the functionality to allow firmware updates through a USB key.

toast.successDisableBmcShell: Successfully disabled BMC shell (via SSH), Please allow 15 seconds for the disable to become effective.
toast.successNextBootToast: Applying changes to %{policy}. Changes made to %{policy} will take effect on next reboot.

pagePolicies.vtpmDescription: Enabling vTPM makes a TPM available to the guest operating system.

pagePostCodeLogs.viewCodesInRealtime: View progress codes in real time

pagePower.description: Set a power cap to keep power consumption at or below the specified value in watts
pagePower.powerConsumptionTooltip: Power consumption will be available once PHYP is running

alert.message: The system is currently operating with reduced performance due to Safe Mode. Power settings are not accessible while in safe mode.
alert.message3: The system will attempt to exit Safe Mode on the next power on attempt. To reboot the server, visit

delayTimeValidation.enterDelayTime: Value cannot be less than delay time to exit.
delayTimeValidation.exitDelayTime: Value cannot be greater than delay time to enter.

modalEnablePowerPerformanceMode.content: Enabling any of the power saver modes will cause changes in processor frequencies, changes in processor utilization, changes in power consumption, and performance to vary.
modalEnablePowerPerformanceMode.subTitle: Are you sure?

tableRoles.descMaximumPerformance: Processor frequency will vary. This mode allows the system to reach the maximum frequency by taking advantage of the thermal and power headroom provided by idle cores, lower workloads, and favorable environmental conditions.
tableRoles.descPowerSaving: Processor frequency is set to a fixed minimum value, reducing the power consumption of the system while still delivering predictable performance.
tableRoles.descStatic: Processor frequency is set to a fixed value that can run normal workloads under normal environmental conditions.

utilizationPercentValidation.enterUtilization: Value cannot be greater than threshold to exit.
utilizationPercentValidation.exitUtilization: Value cannot be less than threshold to enter.

toast.errorPowerPerformanceModes: Error saving power and performance mode

pagePowerRestorePolicy.description: Configure power policy to determine how the system starts after a power disturbance.

policiesDesc.AlwaysOff: Always off - The system always remains powered off when power is applied.
policiesDesc.AlwaysOn: Always on - The system always powers on when power is applied.
policiesDesc.LastState: Last state - The system returns to its last on or off power state when power is applied.

alert.manualOperatingMode: Power restore policy can not be changed while in manual operating  mode.

pageProfileSettings.timezoneDisplayDesc: Select how time is displayed throughout the application

pageRebootBmc.rebootInformation: When you reboot the BMC, your web browser loses contact with the BMC for several minutes. When the BMC is back online, you may need to log in again.

modal.confirmMessage: Are you sure you want to reboot the BMC?
modal.confirmMessage2: A system dump is being offloaded. Rebooting the BMC will result in the dump being lost.

pageSensors.alert: This page might take a few minutes to load

pageServerPowerOperations.immediateReboot: Immediate – Server reboots without operating system shutting down; may cause data corruption
pageServerPowerOperations.immediateShutdown: Immediate - Server shuts down without operating system shutting down; may cause data corruption
pageServerPowerOperations.oneTimeBootWarning: Pending one time boot. Next boot will be performed with the specified one time boot settings. Subsequent boots will be performed with the default settings.
pageServerPowerOperations.operationInProgress: There are no options to display while a power operation is in progress. When complete, power operations will be displayed here.
pageServerPowerOperations.orderlyReboot: Orderly – operating system shuts down, then server reboots
pageServerPowerOperations.orderlyShutdown: Orderly - operating system shuts down, then server shuts down
pageServerPowerOperations.osRuntimeMessage: Continue to OS running state to continue to runtime.

biosSettings.nonHMCManaged: Enabled only when the system is non HMC-managed
biosSettings.selectedOperatingModeManual: On save operating mode will be set to Manual

description.autoStartOnly: Activate server firmware and partitions automatically only in the case of a recovery power on after an abnormal termination (e.g. auto power restart or system termination auto-reboot).
description.autoStartAlways: Activate certain partitions automatically. If the server is powered on using the HMC or ASMI menus, the server automatically activates the partitions configured for 'auto-start'. If an auto-power restart or a reboot is performed after the server stops abnormally, the server activates the partitions that were running at the time the system stopped.
description.standBy: Do not activate server firmware and partitions automatically for either a user-initiated power on or a recovery power on.

description.aix: System firmware will select AIX/Linux as default partition environment.
description.linux: System firmware will select AIX/Linux as default partition environment.
description.ibmI: Server firmware will select IBM i as default partition environment.
description.default: System firmware will automatically select the default partition environment based on system brand type.

setting.partitionBoot: This partition boots directly to the operating system
setting.serviceBoot: Service boot mode from saved list
setting.serviceBootMode: Service mode boot from default list

description.partitionBoot: The partition boots to the operating system without stopping.
description.serviceBoot: The system boots from the saved service mode boot list. This is typically a shorthand method of executing the partition's diagnostics.  To make this option useful, the partition operating system must support diagnostic boot and diagnostics must be loaded on the partition's disk drive.
description.bootToSms: The partition stops at the System Management Services (SMS) menu.
description.bootToOpenFirware: The system stops at the open firmware prompt.
description.serviceBootMode: The system boots from the default boot list.  This option is the preferred way to run stand-alone diagnostics from a CD-ROM drive.

description.a: IPL from disk using copy A of the system Licensed Internal Code.
description.b: IPL from disk using copy B of the system Licensed Internal Code.
description.c: Reserved for hardware service use only.
description.d: IPL from media other than load-source disk. Alternate IPL for code installation support.

pvm_os_boot_type.A_Mode: A (Boot from disk using copy A)
pvm_os_boot_type.B_Mode: B (Boot from disk using copy B)
pvm_os_boot_type.C_Mode: C (Reserved for IBM lab use only)

pvm_rpa_boot_mode.DefaultList: Service mode boot from default list
pvm_rpa_boot_mode.Normal: The partition boots directly to the operating system
pvm_rpa_boot_mode.PblBootLid: The partition boots from the petitboot boot loader
pvm_rpa_boot_mode.SavedList: Service mode boot from saved list

pvm_system_power_off_policy.automaticHelperText: With this setting, when the system is not partitioned, the behavior is the same as power off, and when the system is partitioned, the behavior of the system is the same as stay on
pvm_system_power_off_policy.powerOffHelperText: When the last partition powers off, the server will power off
pvm_system_power_off_policy.stayOnHelperText: When the last partition powers off, the server will stay on
